newsitem.title: FINLAND: HK-RUOKATALO SAYS '96 RESULT POSITIVE, SALES LOWER.
newsitem.headline: HK-RUOKATALO SAYS '96 RESULT POSITIVE, SALES LOWER.

text.p: Finnish foods group HK-Ruokatalo Oy said on Thursday its result for 1996 would be positive despite lower estimated net sales.
"Net sales are estimated to be about 2,350 million markka, which was about 83 million markka lower than in 1995," the company said in a statement.
"The result will nevertheless be clearly positive..." it said.
"Price levels have fallen clearly more than expected, and this has been due to tough domestic price competition. This has also had a negative effect on the company's result," HK-Ruokatalo said.
However, the preliminary net sales figure is not comparable with the the net sales figures of the company's predecessor, LSO Foods, it said.
HK-Ruokatalo said it had on Thursday applied to the Helsinki Stock Exchange to obtain a listing for its A share on the Brokers' list.
The name change to HK Ruokatalo Oy, from LSO Foods Oy, was entered in the trade register on January 17, the company said.
